name: The Mercury

reviews.text: Hotel is tatty and very lived in, with chipped paint, worn carpets and the smell of damp in some of the bedrooms.
reviews.title: Tatty Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WE ARE JUST BACK FROM A 10 DAY STAY AT THE MURCURY , We found it faultless here in every way , the hospitality shown by glynn,kwez & staff was fantastic , coupled with the friendly atmosphere , the rooms are nice (serviced daily) , well heated . and very confortably furnished , breakfast was excellent (and plenty of it ) theres something going on there every night in the well stocked bar ( happy hours 2 ) entertainment is fantastic . would recommend any one to stay here its truly great
reviews.title: Loved the Mercury

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING ON 1 LEVEL & FRIENDLYNESS OF ALL WHO WORK THERE

reviews.text: glynn & kwen the mercury is a credit to you both , we wish you both all the very best for the future (we,ll be back no worries )
reviews.title: Very Much A Family Atmosphere, Home From Home

reviews.text: I had my engagement party here in Nov 2009 and Kwez and Glynn were so helpful and flexible with any of our requests, it was by far the best location for our do. Kwez and Glynn went out of their way to make our party special for us and every single one of our 110 guests had a fantastic time, especially the food which was absolutely gorgeous and at a very reasonable cost! I highly recommend this venue for functions! I've also stayed over there and it was lovely, breakfast was amazing and everything was done to make our stay really nice..
reviews.title: Excellent venue to have a function!!
Perfect venue for our wedding reception
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for our wedding reception, we found all the staff to be very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was brilliant, food was lovely and all our family and friends gave great feedback on the accommodation. We would defintely recomend this venue for family events and functions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At a fantastic budget price, we found this hotel by chance. At quarter of a mile from jct 5 of the M61 motorway at Bolton (with plenty of free parking) it's perfect for travellers stopping off en route and is equally placed between Manchester & Preston. At this price don't expect too many frills, but there is free Wi-fi for those who can't do without t'internet and the rooms are warm & clean, the bathrooms perfectly adequate with great white towels, and, to top it all, the staff brilliantly friendly. We quickly became acquainted with the owners, Kwez & Glynn who took a very personal 'hands on' approach to making us feel very welcome from booking in and throughout our stay. Nothing was too much of a problem, and we felt very comfortable, so much so, we spent far too much time in the hotel, socialising with other guests, but not regretting one minute of it!
reviews.title: This is the friendliest 'home from home'

reviews.text: There's a host of other good pubs & restaurants very close by and Bolton nightlife is a 10 minute taxi ride away.
reviews.title: Dont stay here

reviews.text: Food is home-cooked and glorious, and the hidden gem here is that there's a whole social circle going on, particularly at weekends when the place is packed with a middle-aged, friendly crowd, who come from as far as the Wirral, who really live it up to free live entertainment and made us feel as though we had been coming here for years!
reviews.title: Wedding Reception and Leisure Break

description: A home from home with live entertainment - what more could you want? This privately run establishment offers friendly service, comfort and has entertainment in the bar seven nights a week. Or you can relax in your room watching the freeview television, use the free wireless internet access or have a warm bath or shower in your en-suite. With our home made food you are sure to enjoy your evening at The Mercury.
